comments.commentBody:
It's snowing outside. Could I reasonably assume the temperature is at or below freezing? Would it be a stretch for you to believe me?

The NY Times and the Washington Post do not publish without carefully sourcing.

These reports are from intelligence sources. That's about as factual as the snow outside my window.

I don't care how Sessions may parse what he told his colleagues. He raised his hand and swore! That's a fact! They twice asked about any contact with Russians. He denied any. That's a fact! Now it turns out he did have contact - during the time of the campaign. Another fact!

Many snowflakes....

Get these liars and Treasonous conspirators OUT of my government! That the top law enforcement official lied? That the current "resident" is a sociopath who surrounds himself with people like himself?

What has this nation come to? Will the GOP now put our Republic before their sycophancy to a sociopath and his lying cronies?

So much is wrong here that I don't know exactly how to comment, but I need to.  I wish the Obama Administration had gone public with what it had before they left office.  Now, it is in the hands of folks whose only goal is to protect themselves and their power,  FBI and its director have lost my trust.  We need a special prosecutor.  AG Sessions needs to recuse himself from this investigation or resign.  The corruption that is being countenanced by the GOP and the American people is dangerous and unconscionable.
And yet no proof is ever presented or actual accusations are ever made! This is like the mean girls spreading rumours. EXCEPT IT IS SEDITION!

Technically, Sessions did not perjure himself; what he did was evade Sen. Franken's question entirely. It may not fit the legal requirements of lying, but it is certainly not the Whole Truth he just swore to tell. If you parse it out, (remember the word *parse*? we learned it during the Republican investigations of W. Clinton), he specifically denied speaking w Russia "to discuss issues of the campaign." Ok. So, when you did speak to the Russian ambassador, what was the content of those discussions?

On a different but related note: if the trump tax returns wind up being supporting evidence of collusion with a foreign power, is the collective Republican effort to keep those tax returns hidden a form of obstruction of justice? Conspiracy? Aiding and abetting? Considering their relentlessness over the past 30+ years in investigating anything and everything Clinton, why the newfound reluctance to shed light on current matters which are of much more importance than anything Bill & Hill ever were accused of?

There are plenty of suspects for the hacking. Including these guys who were also found with an external server that they were streaming congressional data to. Again the so called media ignoring this so that they go continue the Russian hacking meme. Most likely this is where the wiki leaks data came from.

http://www.politico.com/story/2017/02/house-staff-criminal-investigation...

Session lied under oath.

Either you believe in the law, or you believe in Jeff Sessions. You cannot believe in both.

If he wasn't doing anything, why did he lie about it?

replies.commentBody:
Bill Clinton got disbarred for misleading statements made under oath.

It's not treason and possibly not perjury, but given what happened to Clinton, it's worthy of disbarment.

comments.commentBody: Bernie Sanders spent his honeymoon in Russia, NYT that's OK. Hillary Clinton helped sell 1/4 of the US nuclear minerals rights to Russia, and the Clinton Foundation received millions, NYT that's OK. Jeff Sessions talked to a russian official, NYT "HANG HIM for treason!" And I thought the NYT was a free independent unbiased media outlet.

To show gratitude to the New York Times for reporting this mess, I strongly encouraged the DNC to work furiously to target House, Senate and State seats for the re-election, NOW! The Trump Administration and the billionaires who bank him will surely block an investigation, and only by retaking some of government, can we know the truth.

The Losers weren't rushing to PRESERVE "intelligence", they were rushing to EMBELLISH IT.

Horrifying. Sad.

IMHO I dont think NYT staff writers know what "hacking"--a technical misnomer anyhow--is. ARSTechnica has a better story debunking this complete load of horse manure: arstechnica.com/security/2016/12/did-russia-tamper-with-the-2016-electio...

replies.commentBody: You mean all 77k of them compared to Hillary's three million more? Surely you jest! What message?

comments.commentBody: I fail to see anything more than allegations from unnamed persons. I doubted the Russian connection from the first time Padesta uttered it. The Clinton campaign manager should not have access to intelligence and was of course the person who used password as his password. And to issue praise for the beloved Obama officials is laughable. I guess NYT will continue this crazy narrative in the hope that people will believe this nonsense. We're the hacked emails false? Didn't the head of the DNC resign, or did the Russians falsely malign her? And I certainly do not want to hear anything from the mouths of Nancy or Chuck, from the minority party. Poor losers all and their behavior is shameful. Didn't they hear any message from the voters?

Please. More of the same drivel from WaPo. Let's cut to the chase: the Russians did not steal the election from Hillary and give it to Trump. Trump and his staff did not collude with the Russians to 'hack' (whatever that means) the election. Trump will not be impeached. He is the President, probably for the next eight years. Grow up.

The Trump "Russiagate" fiasco resembles a deja vu all over again--a revisit of the lying Richard Nixon years and the downfall of his administration.  Nixon and his cronies lied and stonewalled the Watergate investigation until the very end.  Sean Spicer is beginning to sound like poor Ron Ziegler.  Hopefully, a new Howard Baker will emerge among the Senate Republicans and carry out a thorough and complete investigation of this sordid matter.

All I am looking for is some intellectual consistency from people. If you were someone who was legitimately upset, outraged etc...  over Hillary's somewhat loose relationship with the truth then you MUST be up in arms about this as well. If we have devolved into a "democracy" where we unequivocally hate our fellow citizens who disagree with us, impugn their patriotism as a matter of course and accept deceit and immorality by elected officials as long as they are on our "side" then we are well on the way to losing what made us "a shining city on a hill".... SAD!!!

The truth has come out. Donna Brazile gave Hilary Clinton help in her debates with Bernie Sanders and Debby Wasserman helped the Clinton campaign with decisions about the debate schedule, etc. The Russians hacked the DNC to pry these truths out of the Democratic party. What other details are there? Did Putin prevent Hilary from campaigning in Wisconsin and Ohio? Did the Russians influence black Americans to give more of their vote to Trump than they gave to Romney? Did Putin influence the people running Clintons campaign to ignore Bill's advice?

Not surprising that mouthpiece Spicer would try to discredit the evidence. Less logical, that Republicans in Congress would try do the same thing. This would be a combined Congress/White-House whitewash, with national security implications. Is this a first in history? Why don't they just evacuate the buildings that contain evidence and burn them down. The Trump firm could then redevelop a capital in another town, say, Richmond, VA. Silverware in the cafeteria will come from Russia.

replies.commentBody: Sorry, but the guy who made his career off of using "people are saying" as proof of Obama's foreign birth has to lie in the bed he made for himself.

comments.commentBody: Hearsay is not PROOF. Jeez, publish something with facts and not opinion while quoting unnamed sources.  Don't become the fake news.
Associates.  Pretty vague I would say.  Am I the only one that remembers Obama's meddling in the Israeli election, where he worked vigorously to defeat Bebe?
Spicer denies it all. Trump denies it all. And we know how honest they both are.

When will the investigations and media pouncing start about The Obama Administration spending millions of TAX PAYER DOLLARS to influence the last Israel's election trying to defeat Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu. They failed (like usual) but it still happened.
Fake news. NYT=fake newspaper. Drain the swamp.
"Yes, I was at the strip club twice, but I closed my eyes when the dancers began to remove their clothing."

WOW! History does repeat itself. Meddling in election campaigns and stealing private information from the other side by secret operatives of the presidential candidate! Cover-ups by the President-elect! Lying to Congress by the Attorney General! This is beginning to look like Watergate all over again. What did the President know and when did he know it?

More importantly: How much classified information, like how the Obama administration learned who did the hacking of the DNC and Podesta? and who in Russia supplied info to American intelligence? has the Trump administration now revealed to Russian intelligence agencies now that they have access to the highest level of classified information? Is there treasonous activity taking place in the White House at this very moment? And they called Hillary Clinton a "Crook" for using a private e-mail server!! Is our current President selling out the country to Putin because Putin's hackers have really scandalous information on Trump?

More Fake News.

ALL Administrations have to preserve anything that even approaches value.

Non-Story.....AGAIN!

This article reads like the script of "Absence of Malice".  Long on conjecture without any facts or specifics of illegal actions.  Obama's people had one priority, to get Hillary elected.  Their failure to do that is now sprouting conspiracy theories like this to deflect responsibility.  By the standards of this article Obama's off the mic comment to Putin about having more latitude to work with him after his reelection should have been an impeachable offense.  So much for truth and facts, this paper is nothing but smoke and innuendo for the disaffected losers of the last election.  How sad.
